January 7, 1990: Fiction
THE DARK HALF, by Stephen King. (Viking, $21.95.) After a writer of horror tales
kills off his pseudonym, the deceased goes on a murderous rampage.
DADDY, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $19.95.) Unexpected crises wreck the safe,
predictable world a man has built for himself and his family.
CLEAR AND PRESENT DANGER, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $21.95.) The C.I.A.'s
Jack Ryan fights Colombian drug lords.
CARIBBEAN, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $22.95.) The history of the
sea islands told in fictional form.
FOUCAULT'S PENDULUM, by Umberto Eco. (Wolff/Harcourt Brace Jovanovich,
$22.95.) Ancient documents and arcane codes produce astonishing results when
thrown into a computer.
TALES FROM MARGARITAVILLE, by Jimmy Buffett. (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich,
$16.95.) Short stories set on a mythical Caribbean island.
THE POLAR EXPRESS, written and illustrated by Chris Van Allsburg. (Houghton
Mifflin, $16.95.) A small boy's Christmas Eve train ride.
JIMMY STEWART AND HIS POEMS, by Jimmy Stewart. (Crown, $9.95.) Verses
by the venerable motion picture star.
STRAIGHT, by Dick Francis. (Putnam, $18.95.) After the accidental death of his
brother, a steeplechase jockey inherits property and a mysterious enemy.
THE ELEVENTH HOUR, by Graeme Base. (Abrams, $14.95.) An illustrated
mystery story about a birthday party attended by 11 animals.
CALIFORNIA GOLD, by John Jakes. (Random House, $19.95.) A young man
from Pennsylvania makes his fortune in 19th-century Los Angeles.
THE PILLARS OF THE EARTH, by Ken Follett. (Morrow, $22.95.) The lives of
men and women whose fortunes are linked by the construction of a cathedral in
12th-century England.
SWAN LAKE, by Mark Helprin. (Ariel/Houghton Mifflin, $19.95.) A new retelling of
the fable upon which the ballet is based, with illustrations by Chris Van Allsburg.
THE JOY LUCK CLUB, by Amy Tan. (Putnam, $18.95.) The tensions and bonds
shared by Chinese- American women and their immigrant mothers.
SPY LINE, by Len Deighton. (Knopf, $18.95.) To salvage his reputation, the British
agent Bernard Samson undertakes a hazardous mission in Vienna.
January 7, 1990
Non-Fiction
IT WAS ON FIRE WHEN I LAY DOWN ON IT, by Robert Fulghum. (Villard,
$17.95.) A new collection of inspirational essays.
ALL I REALLY NEED TO KNOW I LEARNED IN KINDERGARTEN, by Robert
Fulghum. (Villard, $17.95.) Inspirational essays about everyday matters.
ROSEANNE, by Roseanne Barr. (Harper & Row, $18.95.) The autobiography of
the television comedian.
MY TURN, by Nancy Reagan with William Novak. (Random House, $21.95.) The
former First Lady's memoir of her White House years.
EDUCATION OF A WANDERING MAN, by Louis L'Amour. (Bantam, $16.95.) The
author recalls the places he visited and the books he read in his youth.
ALL MY BEST FRIENDS, by George Burns with David Fisher. (Putnam, $17.95.)
Reminiscences about show business acquaintances.
LIAR'S POKER, by Michael Lewis. (Norton, $18.95.) Wall Street's tumultuous
1980's, as witnessed by a young bond trader.
DRIVE, by Larry Bird with Bob Ryan. (Doubleday, $17.95.) The autobiography of
the Boston Celtics basketball star.
CHRONICLE OF AMERICA, edited by Clifton Daniel. (ECAM/Prentice Hall,
$49.95.) A profusely illustrated history of what is now the United States, event by
event, from ancient times to the present.
CHILI DAWGS ALWAYS BARK AT NIGHT, by Lewis Grizzard. (Villard, $17.95.)
Essays on politics, religion, sex, golf, etc.
THE TEMPTING OF AMERICA, by Robert H. Bork. (Free Press, $22.50.) A
critique of the relationship between politics and the law by Ronald Reagan's
Supreme Court nominee.
A BRIEF HISTORY OF TIME, by Stephen W. Hawking. (Bantam, $18.95.) A
scientist reviews efforts to create a unified theory of the universe.
AMONG SCHOOLCHILDREN, by Tracy Kidder. (Todd/Houghton Mifflin, $19.95.)
A year in the life of a fifth-grade teacher in Holyoke, Mass.
I WANT TO GROW HAIR, I WANT TO GROW UP, I WANT TO GO TO BOISE, by
Erma Bombeck. (Harper & Row, $16.95.) Fifteen stories of children surviving
cancer.
BO, by Bo Schembechler and Mitch Albom. (Warner, $17.95.) Big-time college
football as lived and observed by the former coach of the Michigan Wolverines.
